GlassSphere.description: A circular container with an image inside, overlaid with complex gradients to simulate a solid glass marble.
structure: Overlay (absolute, inset-0, z-10, radial-gradient for shine)

tailwind_classes.container: relative aspect-square w-full rounded-full overflow-hidden cursor-pointer transition-all duration-500 ease-out
tailwind_classes.image: absolute inset-0 w-full h-full object-cover transition-transform duration-700 ease-in-out hover:scale-110

GlassSphere.custom_css: .glass-overlay { background: radial-gradient(circle at 30% 30%, rgba(255,255,255,0.8) 0%, rgba(255,255,255,0.1) 25%, rgba(0,0,0,0.1) 100%); box-shadow: inset -10px -10px 20px rgba(0,0,0,0.1), inset 5px 5px 10px rgba(255,255,255,0.5); }

HeroTitle.classes: text-center font-['Anton'] text-black mix-blend-difference z-20 relative pointer-events-none select-none

layout.grid_strategy: Masonry-style or Staggered Grid. 2 columns on mobile with offset margins.
layout.spacing: Gap-4 or Gap-6. Padding-4 for screen edges.

blur_effect.keyframes: @keyframes blur-jump { 0% { filter: blur(0px); transform: scale(1); } 40% { filter: blur(8px); transform: scale(0.95); } 100% { filter: blur(0px); transform: scale(1); } }

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. Install framer-motion: `yarn add framer-motion` (CRITICAL for smooth interactions).
2. Create a global CSS file or add to App.css the `@import` for Anton/Manrope fonts.
3. Implement the `GlassSphere` component with the custom CSS gradients for the realistic look.
4. Use a `Masonry` layout or simple alternating columns for the grid.
5. Ensure the 'Soon Places' title is fixed or sticky if needed, or just massive at the top.
6. Apply the `blur-jump` keyframe animation to the `onClick` event of the sphere.
7. Keep the background purely white (#FFFFFF) to make the glass effect pop.
